questions.question_text:
Given two statements below :

Statement I : In $$\mathrm{Cl}_{2}$$ molecule the covalent radius is double of the atomic radius of chlorine.

Statement II : Radius of anionic species is always greater than their parent atomic radius.

Choose the most appropriate answer from options given below :
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
options.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
options.C: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
options.D: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).

Assertion (A) : Experimental reaction of $$\mathrm{CH}_{3} \mathrm{Cl}$$ with aniline and anhydrous $$\mathrm{AlCl}_{3}$$ does not give $$o$$ and $$p$$-methylaniline.

Reason (R): The $$-\mathrm{NH}_{2}$$ group of aniline becomes deactivating because of salt formation with anhydrous $$\mathrm{AlCl}_{3}$$ and hence yields $$m$$-methyl aniline as the product.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: Both A and R are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
options.B: Both A and R are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).

questions.question:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R). 
Assertion (A) : Experimental reaction of $$\mathrm{CH}_{3} \mathrm{Cl}$$ with aniline and anhydrous $$\mathrm{AlCl}_{3}$$ does not give $$o$$ and $$p$$-methylaniline. 
Reason (R): The $$-\mathrm{NH}_{2}$$ group of aniline becomes deactivating because of salt formation with anhydrous $$\mathrm{AlCl}_{3}$$ and hence yields $$m$$-methyl aniline as the product. 
In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

questions.question_text:
Chlorophyll extracted from the crushed green leaves was dissolved in water to make $$2 \mathrm{~L}$$ solution of Mg of concentration $$48\, \mathrm{ppm}$$. The number of atoms of $$\mathrm{Mg}$$ in this solution is $$x \times 10^{20}$$ atoms. The value of $$x$$ is ___________. (Nearest Integer)

(Given : Atomic mass of $$\mathrm{Mg}$$ is $$24 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1} ; \mathrm{N}_{\mathrm{A}}=6.02 \times 10^{23} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}$$ )
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:
Chlorophyll extracted from the crushed green leaves was dissolved in water to make $$2 \mathrm{~L}$$ solution of Mg of concentration $$48\, \mathrm{ppm}$$. The number of atoms of $$\mathrm{Mg}$$ in this solution is $$x \times 10^{20}$$ atoms. The value of $$x$$ is ___________. (Nearest Integer) 
(Given : Atomic mass of $$\mathrm{Mg}$$ is $$24 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1} ; \mathrm{N}_{\mathrm{A}}=6.02 \times 10^{23} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}$$ )

questions.question_text:
The wavelength of an electron and a neutron will become equal when the velocity of the electron is $$x$$ times the velocity of neutron. The value of $$x$$ is ____________. (Nearest Integer)

(Mass of electron is $$9.1 \times 10^{-31} \mathrm{~kg}$$ and mass of neutron is $$1.6 \times 10^{-27} \mathrm{~kg}$$ )
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.question_text:
$$2.4 \mathrm{~g}$$ coal is burnt in a bomb calorimeter in excess of oxygen at $$298 \mathrm{~K}$$ and $$1 \mathrm{~atm}$$ pressure. The temperature of the calorimeter rises from $$298 \mathrm{~K}$$ to $$300 \mathrm{~K}$$. The enthalpy change during the combustion of coal is $$-x \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}$$. The value of $$x$$ is ___________. (Nearest Integer)

(Given : Heat capacity of bomb calorimeter $$20.0 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~K}^{-1}$$. Assume coal to be pure carbon)
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:
$$2.4 \mathrm{~g}$$ coal is burnt in a bomb calorimeter in excess of oxygen at $$298 \mathrm{~K}$$ and $$1 \mathrm{~atm}$$ pressure. The temperature of the calorimeter rises from $$298 \mathrm{~K}$$ to $$300 \mathrm{~K}$$. The enthalpy change during the combustion of coal is $$-x \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}$$. The value of $$x$$ is ___________. (Nearest Integer) 
(Given : Heat capacity of bomb calorimeter $$20.0 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~K}^{-1}$$. Assume coal to be pure carbon)

(Molar mass of nitric acid is 63 g mol$$-$$1)

questions.question_text:
At $$298 \mathrm{~K}$$, the equilibrium constant is $$2 \times 10^{15}$$ for the reaction :

$$\mathrm{Cu}(\mathrm{s})+2 \mathrm{Ag}^{+}(\mathrm{aq}) \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{Cu}^{2+}(\mathrm{aq})+2 \mathrm{Ag}(\mathrm{s})$$

The equilibrium constant for the reaction

$$
\frac{1}{2} \mathrm{Cu}^{2+}(\mathrm{aq})+\mathrm{Ag}(\mathrm{s}) \rightleftharpoons \frac{1}{2} \mathrm{Cu}(\mathrm{s})+\mathrm{Ag}^{+}(\mathrm{aq})
$$

is $$x \times 10^{-8}$$. The value of $$x$$ is _____________. (Nearest Integer)
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:
At $$298 \mathrm{~K}$$, the equilibrium constant is $$2 \times 10^{15}$$ for the reaction : 
$$\mathrm{Cu}(\mathrm{s})+2 \mathrm{Ag}^{+}(\mathrm{aq}) \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{Cu}^{2+}(\mathrm{aq})+2 \mathrm{Ag}(\mathrm{s})$$ 
The equilibrium constant for the reaction 
$$
\frac{1}{2} \mathrm{Cu}^{2+}(\mathrm{aq})+\mathrm{Ag}(\mathrm{s}) \rightleftharpoons \frac{1}{2} \mathrm{Cu}(\mathrm{s})+\mathrm{Ag}^{+}(\mathrm{aq})
$$
is $$x \times 10^{-8}$$. The value of $$x$$ is _____________. (Nearest Integer)

questions.question_text: The number of distinct real roots of the equation $$x^{5}\left(x^{3}-x^{2}-x+1\right)+x\left(3 x^{3}-4 x^{2}-2 x+4\right)-1=0$$ is ______________.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.question_text: If $$\mathrm{n}(2 \mathrm{n}+1) \int_{0}^{1}\left(1-x^{\mathrm{n}}\right)^{2 \mathrm{n}} \mathrm{d} x=1177 \int_{0}^{1}\left(1-x^{\mathrm{n}}\right)^{2 \mathrm{n}+1} \mathrm{~d} x$$, then $$\mathrm{n} \in \mathbf{N}$$ is equal to ______________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: If $$\mathrm{n}(2 \mathrm{n}+1) \int_{0}^{1}\left(1-x^{\mathrm{n}}\right)^{2 \mathrm{n}} \mathrm{d} x=1177 \int_{0}^{1}\left(1-x^{\mathrm{n}}\right)^{2 \mathrm{n}+1} \mathrm{~d} x$$, then $$\mathrm{n} \in \mathbf{N}$$ is equal to ______________.

questions.question_text: The equations of the sides $$\mathrm{AB}, \mathrm{BC}$$ and $$\mathrm{CA}$$ of a triangle $$\mathrm{ABC}$$ are $$2 x+y=0, x+\mathrm{p} y=15 \mathrm{a}$$ and $$x-y=3$$ respectively. If its orthocentre is $$(2, a),-\frac{1}{2}<\mathrm{a}<2$$, then $$\mathrm{p}$$ is equal to ______________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: The equations of the sides $$\mathrm{AB}, \mathrm{BC}$$ and $$\mathrm{CA}$$ of a triangle $$\mathrm{ABC}$$ are $$2 x+y=0, x+\mathrm{p} y=15 \mathrm{a}$$ and $$x-y=3$$ respectively. If its orthocentre is $$(2, a),-\frac{1}{2}<\mathrm{a}<2$$, then $$\mathrm{p}$$ is equal to ______________.

questions.question_text: Let the function $$f(x)=2 x^{2}-\log _{\mathrm{e}} x, x>0$$, be decreasing in $$(0, \mathrm{a})$$ and increasing in $$(\mathrm{a}, 4)$$. A tangent to the parabola $$y^{2}=4 a x$$ at a point $$\mathrm{P}$$ on it passes through the point $$(8 \mathrm{a}, 8 \mathrm{a}-1)$$ but does not pass through the point $$\left(-\frac{1}{a}, 0\right)$$. If the equation of the normal at $$P$$ is : $$\frac{x}{\alpha}+\frac{y}{\beta}=1$$, then $$\alpha+\beta$$ is equal to ________________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let the function $$f(x)=2 x^{2}-\log _{\mathrm{e}} x, x>0$$, be decreasing in $$(0, \mathrm{a})$$ and increasing in $$(\mathrm{a}, 4)$$. A tangent to the parabola $$y^{2}=4 a x$$ at a point $$\mathrm{P}$$ on it passes through the point $$(8 \mathrm{a}, 8 \mathrm{a}-1)$$ but does not pass through the point $$\left(-\frac{1}{a}, 0\right)$$. If the equation of the normal at $$P$$ is : $$\frac{x}{\alpha}+\frac{y}{\beta}=1$$, then $$\alpha+\beta$$ is equal to ________________.

questions.question_text: Let $$\mathrm{Q}$$ and $$\mathrm{R}$$ be two points on the line $$\frac{x+1}{2}=\frac{y+2}{3}=\frac{z-1}{2}$$ at a distance $$\sqrt{26}$$ from the point $$P(4,2,7)$$. Then the square of the area of the triangle $$P Q R$$ is ___________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let $$\mathrm{Q}$$ and $$\mathrm{R}$$ be two points on the line $$\frac{x+1}{2}=\frac{y+2}{3}=\frac{z-1}{2}$$ at a distance $$\sqrt{26}$$ from the point $$P(4,2,7)$$. Then the square of the area of the triangle $$P Q R$$ is ___________.

questions.question_text:
Three masses $$M=100 \mathrm{~kg}, \mathrm{~m}_{1}=10 \mathrm{~kg}$$ and $$\mathrm{m}_{2}=20 \mathrm{~kg}$$ are arranged in a system as shown in figure. All the surfaces are frictionless and strings are inextensible and weightless. The pulleys are also weightless and frictionless. A force $$\mathrm{F}$$ is applied on the system so that the mass $$\mathrm{m}_{2}$$ moves upward with an acceleration of $$2 \mathrm{~ms}^{-2}$$. The value of $$\mathrm{F}$$ is :

( Take $$\mathrm{g}=10 \mathrm{~ms}^{-2}$$ )

The amplitude of the electric field would be :

questions.question_text: A monkey of mass $$50 \mathrm{~kg}$$ climbs on a rope which can withstand the tension (T) of $$350 \mathrm{~N}$$. If monkey initially climbs down with an acceleration of $$4 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}^{2}$$ and then climbs up with an acceleration of $$5 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}^{2}$$. Choose the correct option $$\left(g=10 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}^{2}\right)$$.
questions.subject: Physics

options.C: Rope will break while climbing upward
options.D: Rope will break while going downward

questions.question_text: A disc of mass $$1 \mathrm{~kg}$$ and radius $$\mathrm{R}$$ is free to rotate about a horizontal axis passing through its centre and perpendicular to the plane of disc. A body of same mass as that of disc is fixed at the highest point of the disc. Now the system is released, when the body comes to the lowest position, its angular speed will be $$4 \sqrt{\frac{x}{3 R}} \,\operatorname{rad}{s}^{-1}$$ where $$x=$$ ____________. $$\left(g=10 \mathrm{~ms}^{-2}\right)$$
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A disc of mass $$1 \mathrm{~kg}$$ and radius $$\mathrm{R}$$ is free to rotate about a horizontal axis passing through its centre and perpendicular to the plane of disc. Now the system is released, when the body comes to the lowest position, its angular speed will be $$4 \sqrt{\frac{x}{3 R}} \,\operatorname{rad}{s}^{-1}$$ where $$x=$$ ____________. $$\left(g=10 \mathrm{~ms}^{-2}\right)$$

questions.question_text: In an experiment to determine the Young's modulus of wire of a length exactly $$1 \mathrm{~m}$$, the extension in the length of the wire is measured as $$0.4 \mathrm{~mm}$$ with an uncertainty of $$\pm\, 0.02 \mathrm{~mm}$$ when a load of $$1 \mathrm{~kg}$$ is applied. The diameter of the wire is measured as $$0.4 \mathrm{~mm}$$ with an uncertainty of $$\pm \,0.01 \mathrm{~mm}$$. The error in the measurement of Young's modulus $$(\Delta \mathrm{Y})$$ is found to be $$x \times 10^{10}\, \mathrm{Nm}^{-2}$$. The value of $$x$$ is _________________. $$\left(\right.$$take $$\mathrm{g}=10 \mathrm{~ms}^{-2}$$ )
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: In an experiment to determine the Young's modulus of wire of a length exactly $$1 \mathrm{~m}$$, the extension in the length of the wire is measured as $$0.4 \mathrm{~mm}$$ with an uncertainty of $$\pm\, 0.02 \mathrm{~mm}$$ when a load of $$1 \mathrm{~kg}$$ is applied. The diameter of the wire is measured as $$0.4 \mathrm{~mm}$$ with an uncertainty of $$\pm \,0.01 \mathrm{~mm}$$. The error in the measurement of Young's modulus $$(\Delta \mathrm{Y})$$ is found to be $$x \times 10^{10}\, \mathrm{Nm}^{-2}$$.
